Text: Moneybomb (alternatively money bomb, money-bomb, or fundraising bomb) is a neologism coined in 2007 to describe a grassroots fundraising effort over a brief fixed time period, usually to support a candidate for election by dramatically increasing, concentrating, and publicizing fundraising activity during a specific hour or day.

Text: Moneybomb:  In the case of lesser-known candidates it is also intended to generate significant free mass media coverage the candidate would otherwise not receive.
